{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3149589,"name":"James","username":"JamerGamer789","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T03:03:22.546Z","cooked":"

Hello all!

Our team is new to both Path Planner and swerve drive this year and we are stuck with where to proceed. We know we need to follow trajectory from the Path Planner JSON that is generated, but we don’t really know how to do that and we are on a time crunch. We are using democat’s base sds swerve library with NEO mark 4i swerve kits.

Thank you in advance for the help!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-02-21T03:03:22.546Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":980,"reads":268,"readers_count":267,"score":4953.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":427562,"topic_slug":"new-to-path-planner-and-swerve","display_username":"James","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51278,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/new-to-path-planner-and-swerve/427562/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3149872,"name":"Zane Brotherton","username":"zbrotherton2158","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/77aa72/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T15:36:35.238Z","cooked":"

Depends on whether you are using PathPlannerLib or wpilib for your trajectory following. In my opinion, PathPlannerLib is much easier to use.

Assuming you are using PathPlannerLib, it’s a simple process:
Load each trajectory using PathPlanner.loadPath(), passing in the trajectory’s name from its .path file, and a maximum velocity/acceleration.

PathPlanner.loadPath(".path file name", maxvel (m/s), maxaccel (m/s^2));

Then, construct a PPSwerveControllerCommand, which is well documented on the above PathPlannerLib link. Scheduling this command (returning it in RobotContainer’s getAutonomousCommand() method) will have your swerve drive follow the trajectory.

Check that you reset odometry as documented, or your trajectory will not work correctly.

We are in a similar boat except that we are using falcons with MK4 modules. We just switched over to path planner a couple days ago and kind of got things running last night. The bot drove a nice smooth path, but was flipped around a bit. I didn’t get to spend any time trying to debug it last night, but I’m thinking that we have something simple flipped around somewhere. Below is a picture of our intended path and a picture of what actually happened. I’m not sure what all the lead programmer did last night after I saw it run this path, so I can’t say what condition the code is in right now. But here is a link to our code. It’s on the PathPlanner branch. GitHub - cmc-first-4779/R23ChargedUp at PathPlanner

Screenshot 2023-02-21 1813251270×714 22.8 KB

Screenshot 2023-02-21 1813541273×721 20.9 KB

Have you made sure your driver station says you’re on the blue alliance? Pathplanner horizontally reflects the path for the red alliance because the field is not rotationally symmetrical.

I quickly looked for that setting last night at practice, but didn’t see it when the programmer pulled up the screen. I’ll go look for it. That was my first impression, that the path thought we were on the other alliance. Thanks for the reminder to check that out.

Edited:
I see it now plain as day. I had him look on the settings tab of the driver’s station and not the main tab. My personal laptop top is showing as Red 1. Hopefully the team laptop was set to Red 1 as well which would be one of the easiest fixes in the world.

We just got path planner running tonight, but we don’t have any rotation. We are using the default path when opening a new path planner project.

edit: I at least assume this is supposed to rotate, we are using path planner for the first time so I don’t really know if this is supposed to rotate but from the path it looks like it should.
